events.title: Wanted Boss: Code 87/64/39
events.description:
• Weaknesses - 87:Tanks - 64:Air - 39:Missile
• Spawns for 3 hours at 00:00, 06:00, 12:00, 18:00
• Hit a minimum of 3 times to max rewards
• You can send all three squads at once if you only have 10 seconds to invest

sunday.description: ** Note the different time ** so we can gather for VS

events.title: Frontline Breakthrough
events.description: Complete at least 3 levels for max rewards. (Can be the first level 3 times)

events.title: Register for Desert Storm!
events.description:
• To register:
   Events → Desert Storm → Select Participants → Request to Fight

events.title: VS: Start gathering with extra squads
VS: Deploy Legendary Trucks and Tasks
VS: Stamina, Drone data, and drone parts (Double dip with Arms Race 04:00-08:00)
VS: Unwrap buildings and use construction speedups (Arms Race 08:00-12:00)
VS: Complete Research and use Research Speedups (Double dip with Arms Race 04:00-08:00)
VS: Spend Hero XP, shards, skill medals, exclusive weapon shards (Arms Race 16:00-20:00)
VS: Promote Troops (Arms Race 16:00-20:00), Build/Tech if necessary
VS: Enemy Busters! Kill troops, preferably our opponent
SHIELD!!!
events.description: If you don't plan to hunt in Alliance Assaults or Server wars, put up a 24 hour Shield. Otherwise, use 8 or 12 hours until we see how everything is going.

events.title: Buy what you can from Alliance, VIP, and Campaign Stores.
Doomsday event - Don't forget to collect rewards as they are not mailed
General's Trial - Choose ONE level after what you can solo.
Winter Storm
events.description: • Matching is open for two hours starting at 02:00, 09:00, 19:00

events.title: Crimson Legion
events.description:
• Set your strongest squad to garrison before signing off the night before
• R4s will kick the lowest power garrisons to make room as needed
• Arrive for the event and garrison/heal like a cryptid should!

events.title: Rampage Bosses
events.description:
• Spawn at 0:00, 6:00, and 12:00
• Attacking doesn't cost stamina or troops
• Take three shots on each and try to get as much damage as you can!
• If the server manages to do enough damage, they'll drop rewards you can grab over the next few hours

sunday.description: • NOTE the different time so that we can gather resources!

events.title: Wanted Boss: Code 87 - Weak Against Tank Heroes
Wanted Boss:  Code 64 - Weak Against Missile Heroes
Wanted Boss: Code 39 - Weak Against Aircraft Heroes
Warzone Duel: Capitol War
events.description:
• This is Last War's main event so the rewards are very, very good
• It is fairly easy to max participation rewards starting 1-2 hours after the capitol is contested
• You can only earn ranking rewards while the capitol is being contested

events.title: Mason: Strike Back (Ironclad Vehicle)
events.description: • Burn any spare stamina on these little guys. The rewards add up to much more than Doom Elites not only for you, but for the entire alliance!

events.title: Bullseye Loot/Ammo Bonanza
events.description:
• 3 very simple daily tasks in Ammo Bonanza
• The ammo stays in inventory between events, so you can save up and spend it all at once to get better prizes (Mythic blueprint!)

events.title: Summon Supplies
events.description:
• Get your free key and do your free summon every day
• The keys remain between events so save them until you find a box you really want
• If you have done free summons every day, on the last day:
  • Spend 500 more diamonds to get 10 UR shards
  • Spend 4000 more to get a legendary decoration chest

events.title: Capitol Conquest (trading tile hits at the capitol)
events.description:
• Every week there is a war to see which alliance will control the capitol but in 996, we have an agreement for peaceful transfer of power, so we do not fight.
• To get your rewards:
   • Send your squad to gather at a tile in the mud around the capitol
   • Post the coordinates in world chat for someone to hit
     - OR -
   • Watch for mud tiles to be posted in WC and after verifying the person who posted it is also the one on the tile, attack.

events.title: Season I Celebration → Championship Duel → Predicts
events.description:
• Wager to win Black Market Cash without risking any
• More icon → x4 Elite Match → Predict → x100
• I'm just picking the favorite since I don't feel like doing research

events.title: Season II Celebration → Black Market
events.description:
• Use all of your refreshes every day
• Always buy the free items
• Free/Cheap players recommendation:
   • Top Row
      • Decorations
      • Weapon Shards (until you have enough to unlock all Heroes)
      • if you have plenty of cash, UR Skill Chips, UR decorations
   • Bottom Row:
      • Exclusive Weapons (until enough)

events.title: Hot Deals → Glittering Market
events.description: • At minimum, collect 100 diamonds / Buy 60 coins for 500 diamonds

events.title: Golden Melody
events.description: • Use at minimum 1 ticket, score at least 5,000 points then collect your tasks

events.title: Sky Predator - General's Trial Alliance Challenge
Return of the Dead - Defend Alliance Center
Buy from Alliance, Campaign and VIP stores before reset.
Register for Desert Storm - FINAL DAY (Due 1 hour before reset)

tips.title: Shields
tips.content:
Keep on hand at minimum:
• Three of each teleport
• Three 24 & 12 hour shields
• Five 8 hour shields
If you see a Doom Walker attacking, start a rally on it and then cancel to redirect him

tips.title: Donate to Alliance Tech with thumbs up icon
tips.content:
Make sure to donate to Alliance Tech every time you log in.
Go to: Alliance→Alliance Techs
Look for the tech with the red thumbs-up icon, then hold down the donate button until all coin donations are complete.

Upgrading Alliance Tech is crucial for the alliance's growth, but it also benefits you directly. You earn Alliance Points, which are much more valuable than the coins you spend. These points can be used in the Alliance Store to buy a variety of useful items.

You can also donate using diamonds. The first 10 diamond donations each day only cost a total of 110 diamonds, making them a great deal. After that, the cost increases, so stick to those first 10 if you want the best value.

tips.title: Retry in Honorable Campaign
tips.content: If you lose a battle in Honorable Campaign, retry it a couple times (you can skip through to make it faster). I've gone on to win over 20 additional battles with the same squad after losing one due to bad luck.

tips.title: Save SHINYs for VS
tips.content:
Every three days, you receive a special task we call a SHINY! These are a type of legendary task and are marked with a star in the upper right corner.

SHINYs can be saved for up to three days. Since VS gives points for completing legendary tasks on Tuesdays and Saturdays, you can save your SHINYs and use on those days... except on Wednesdays since they won't last until Saturday.

Important: When refreshing tasks, you will see a warning about uncompleted legendary tasks if you have a SHINY. Don’t worry, refreshing will not remove or affect your SHINY.

tips.title: Earn diamonds with Arena Likes
tips.content:
Every day you are able to go into the Arena and give a three likes in each tab (Storm Arena & 3v3 Brawl)
Each like that you give earns you 30 diamonds, for a total of 180 diamonds per day.
Doing this daily is enough to pay for more than half of your 30 day VIP membership.

tips.title: Rapid Squad Retrieval
tips.content: If your squad is taking too long to get home, use a free teleport to bring it back immediately.

tips.title: Optimizing Helps
tips.content:
Using Quick Dispatch to assign survivors in your Alliance Hub will set them to give you the maximum number of helps, which is ideal for longer builds and research.

For short builds, research and spam healing troops, it's better to manually set your survivors to give the most time per help so each help takes a bigger chunk off the timer.

To get the best of both worlds:
• Set survivors for the maximum number of helps.
• Request help.
• Then switch to survivors that give the most time per help.

tips.title: Popups have freebies!
tips.content: Those annoying popup ads when you first enter the game sometimes have free rewards on them. Take a look before closing them.

tips.title: Arms Race Chests
tips.content: If you forget to collect your Arms Race themes chest, they will not count toward your daily chests, so check, double check and triple check that you collect them in time.

tips.title: Capitol Titles
tips.content:
Capitol titles give major boosts to resource collection, construction, and research - and solid boosts for troop training and healing. Always grab the right title before starting any major action.

How to Apply:
• Tap your PFP → #996 Button → Title → Apply
• When you apply, your name will be added to the bottom of the list and will display your estimated timeslot.
• Slots can shift, so check back often so you don’t miss yours

Title Benefits:
• Secretary of Development: +50% construction speed, +25% research (when active at the start)
• Secretary of Science: +50% research speed, +25% construction
• Secretary of Interior: +100% Food/Iron/Gold output when collecting or using Rapid Production (collect while holding the title)
• Secretary of Security: Train/Promote ~20% more troops in the same time (start while holding the title)
• Secretary of Strategy: +20% hospital capacity and healing speed - great in prolonged PVP

tips.title: Using Diamonds
tips.content:
The most important thing to do with diamonds is to save up 10,000 so you can get 30 days of VIP. After that, keep saving a little, so that you can extend your 30 days before it expires, but feel free to invest.

What you spend them on will change based on what is happening in game, but Some of the most important diamond investments are:
• Keep 3 Advanced Teleports (7,500 points in Alliance Store or 600 diamonds in VIP Store)
• VIP Store: Stamina, 8/3 hour speedups, Legendary/Epic Shards,
• Donate with diamonds 10x per day which helps everyone in the alliance and also gets you 500 points for the alliance store. total cost: 110 diamonds/day

tips.title: Queue Tasks and Bosses
tips.content:
To queue tasks/bosses (henceforth tasks) you need:
• Pinned message to abandoned account (You can name it Queue)
• A timer that lets you set titles. I use Alexa.

• Send the abandoned account the message "1"
• When you come across a task with a timer, share it with Queue
• Say "Alexa, set timer named one point one for [50 seconds less than task timer]"
• For additional tasks, increment the number after "point", e.g. "one point two", "one point three", and so on.
• When a timer ends, open the private message and navigate to the task that is "point X" down from the 1
• [Optional] If it is a 4+ star SHINY task Share it with AC when it has about 30 seconds left.
• When you've accumulated 5 tasks, or are starting to lose track of what number you are on, send the message "2" to your Queue and start naming the tasks "two point one" and so on. This allows the timers to not get mixed up with the previous list.

tips.title: Cancel attack or scout
tips.content:
To cancel an attack/scout
• Go to the world map
• In the upper left click on the squad that is attacking (expand scouts if needed)
• Click the button with the arrow
• Click "confirm"

tips.title: Plunder Warning
tips.content:
[username], You plundered a task or truck from our server which is forbidden. I understand some people don't know this and mistakes can happen.
This message will serve as your one warning and further violations of this rule will be met with an attack on your base.

To find trucks and tasks on other servers:

• Open the Trade Truck menu by scrolling to the far left of your base and clicking the box truck icon

• In "Other's Trucks" tab check the box in the top left to filter out trucks from our warzone

• Click a truck and use the red "Plunder!" button to be teleported to that server. For plundering trucks, only select trucks from our opponent in Warzone Duel's server

• Once there, you can plunder the truck or scan for secret tasks

tips.title: Plundering other servers
tips.content:
To find trucks and tasks on other servers:
• Open the Trade Truck menu by scrolling to the far left of your base and clicking the box truck icon
• In "Other's Trucks" tab check the box in the top left to filter out trucks from our warzone
• Click a truck and use the red "Plunder!" button to be teleported to that server. For plundering trucks, only select trucks from our opponent in Warzone Duel's server
• Once there, you can plunder the truck or scan for secret tasks

tips.title: Warzone Duel: Capitol War - After Main Event
tips.content:
Warzone Duel: Capitol War is the end of a week long battle between servers and is the main event in the game. Since it is the main event, it has really great rewards.

You want to get a total of 1.5 million points to max your rewards. You get 10k damage for every successful hit on bases from our opponent except when you ash them which will give you 50-60k. You can tell who is our opponent because their base will be pink on the map. To attack, you will lose your shield, so that is where the strategy starts

The basics:
1. Make sure you have a pinned conversation with a link to a 3rd server in it so you can teleport out immediately.
2. Remove all squads from your wall.
3. Make sure you have someone strong to garrison you.
4. Use a resource tile or teleport to get close to an inactive pink base. Try to avoid ones from the top few alliances.
5. Attack.
6. If the attack is victorious, check to make sure you didn't lose many (or any) troops and keep hitting until you ash them.
7. If at any point you hear your attack alarm go off, immediately go to your pinned private message and teleport to the 3rd party server.

Other notes:
• To get closer to pink bases instead of waiting for your squad to cross the map, teleport to the 3rd server, wait 4.5 minutes and teleport back to 996
• Every time you teleport, drop your coords in chat so your garrison(s) can follow you.



Back to index

tips.title: Tiered Troops
tips.content:
The best method for this is to Keep your barracks levels tiered and promote them through the levels instead of training them at the max tier. To do this, upgrade one of your barracks as much as possible and check what level troop it can produce. The next barrack, upgrade until the max troop it can produce is one less than the previous barrack. Follow this pattern for each barrack you have.

Example - you have four barracks and the max troop you can produce is level 7
• 1st Barrack at level 20-23 - Produces up to level 7 troops
• 2nd at level 17-16 - Produces up to level 6 troops
• 3rd Barrack at level 14-15 - Produces up to level 5 troops
• 4th Barrack at level 10-13 - Produces up to level 4 troops.

tips.title: Marshal Instructions
tips.content:
Marshal is starting!

• No digs or non-Marshal rallies.
• If needed, to conserve troops, remove all but one hero from SECOND squad.
• Coordinates will be in chat before it starts.
• Launch rallies with your SECOND squad.
• Join rallies with your FIRST squad ONLY.
• Send squads out again as they return - rally with second, join with first.
• After the alliance maxes rewards, check individual rewards. If maxed, rally only (either squad).

tips.title: Zombie Siege Instructions
tips.content:
Siege is starting in 10 minutes!

    **No rallies or digs!**

• Recall all squads and ensure 5 heroes
• Place first squad on wall (more if you need to fill hospital)
• Watch battle reports: if first squad drops below 50%, add another until all squads are in use
• When all squads in use and first still below 50%, request garrison
• If you have power to spare, garrison those who request it
• Refresh garrisons when damaged. Use resource tiles to move faster if needed

tips.title: Spam healing on mobile
Farm Every Day
tips.content:
Farming bases of commanders not in an alliance is a significant contributor to collecting resources. Make sure to do it every day other than those where you must stay shielded.
To get more resources from a single base and to spend way less stamina, work with a group to farm using rallies!

tips.title: Clearing Space in Drill Grounds by killing off troops
tips.content:
If you need more room in your drill grounds, here are two effective ways to reduce troop count

1. Coordinated Tile Hit (Most Effective):
• Find someone from another alliance to help.
• Have them place a strong squad on a resource tile.
• You attack the tile with a weak squad.
Because attackers take the highest losses and it costs zero stamina, this is a fast, efficient method with minimal healing needed.

Optional Stealth Tip:
To avoid breaking your shield, getting war fever, or triggering an attack alert, you can send your squad to gather on the tile before their squad lands. Just make sure their squad lands first, so you end up attacking them rather than defending.

2. Doom Walker Sacrifice:
• Put all three of your squads on your wall.
• Start a rally against a nearby Doom Walker that's too strong for you.
• Ask someone to join your rally with a single-hero squad to avoid excess losses.
• Announce it in Alliance Chat so others don't redirect your rally.

Both methods are great for clearing troops quickly without wasting stamina or extra resources.

tips.title: Send Ghost Op
tips.content: Please send your Ghost Op that has all the conditions met. To do so, go to Ghost Ops, Click on the pending mission on the map, and then click "Execute Now" at the bottom.

tips.title: Trading tile hits
tips.content:
When trading hits, it's important to alternate roles because defenders lose far fewer troops. Most of their units go to the hospital instead of dying. To make the most of your points and minimize losses, follow this system:

• Alternate roles between Attacker and Defender each round.
• The Defender uses a very weak squad so the Attacker earns maximum points and avoids troop losses.
• The Attacker sends their strongest squad.
• Choose a resource tile far enough from both players so you can time the attacks properly.
• The Defender marches to the tile first.
• The Attacker waits until the Defender is nearly on the tile, then sends their march so they land second and become the attacker.
• As long as the attacker sends their march before the defender lands, neither person will lose their shield.
• After each battle, check your hospital to make sure it isn’t overflowing. If it’s getting full, there’s a separate tip available on how to spam heal efficiently.

Please see video for example:

tips.title: Free VS Teleports
tips.content:
Friday reset through Saturday reset, you can teleport for free!

To teleport to another location within our server:
• Click Vs → Alliance Assaults → Attack
• Teleport Anywhere
• Click Vs → Alliance Assaults → Return

To teleport to a specific location:
• Click the location you would like to teleport to
• Click teleport
• At the bottom, check to make sure you are at the desired coordinates
• Click the green button with a checkmark

tips.title: my WAY TO FAST Meteor observations
tips.content:
1. If you teleport over *right when* the crash opens, you’ll likely be blown away from the crash sit but you *do* get a teleport back. Need to figure out if this is a net gain, but it will cost valuable time.

2. Even though it says teleporting within the crash area is free, that’s only true *between servers*. If you're teleporting *within the crash server*, it *does* use a teleport so go home and return.

3. You *cannot* enter the Mud with a shield active. (Yep, we all knew this one.)

4. The only tiles you can gather from while shielded are the tiny little nubs.

5. Zooming out you can see white crystal icons indicating crystals that haven’t been claimed yet.

6. If you want to keep your shield *and* hit someone, start marching to their resource tile *before* they land. If you arrive first you are defending (less troop loss if it is like regular tile hits)

7. When zoomed out, incoming meteor hits show as the icon of the type of resource tile they're targeting, before they even land. Keep an eye out.

8. If you attack someone already holding a resource (look for the floating resource icon above them) and *win*, you’ll earn one of those resources as a reward.

tips.title: Ghost Ops Strategy
tips.content:
• Send purple right away
• Post UR/UR⭐ in chat and send when conditions are met
• For UR⭐ ops, if you have a space, give chat a short notice so anyone who still needs those rewards can join.

To help:
• Volunteer/Join UR/UR⭐ only if you help or conditions already met
• You can only "Join" 3 times, so use it wisely.
• If conditions are met, Send reminder to host to start rally
• If rally sits 10 mins and heroes are needed elsewhere, move on

How to send op that is ready:

tips.title: Welcome to Serenity
tips.content:
Welcome to Serenity!

It’s a little quiet in here, but I pop in and out often. if you need anything, just leave a note in Alliance Chat or if you're not comfortable with that, shoot me or any R4 a message.

If you're active in Marshal, please teleport into the grid around Marshal, lining up in straight lines with one space between each base.

If not, you're welcome to settle around our rally point instead.

tips.title: How to leave a rally
tips.content:
To leave a rally
• Click the red rally button
• Click the blue arrow icon of the rally you are in
• Click the red back arrow icon for your squad

tips.title: How to be VP
tips.content:
VP is easy, just stay focused. I set a timer every 3 minutes just in case. I use timer.fit

How to Apply & Approve:
Apply like any other title. Once approved, you’ll start seeing applications.
Red notification bubbles will show on:
• Your Profile Picture in the upper left of map/base screen
• The #996 button on your profile
• The Capitol title screen

Just follow the notifications and approve all applications - that’s 98% of the job.

Only adjust the queue for these reasons:
• If someone held VP for at least 1 hour, they can be bumped to the front.
• Longer VP time = more bumps.
• The President may also step down occasionally and be bumped.
• Someone sends you a private message asking you to dismiss them from their title.

To bump someone to the front of the line:
• You have from 4:40–5:00 on the timer of the person currently holding the title.
• The blue up arrow next to their name will turn blue and you can click that.
• The Appoint button will turn blue and you can manually search for their username.

Important Note:
If you’re in cross-warzone mode (plundering trucks or tasks), you won’t see notifications or be able to process apps. If your base is located in another warzone, you cannot manage applications at all.

tips.title: Tile pulling to hunt loot goblins
tips.content:
Hunting Loot Goblins Efficiently

To hunt loot goblins quickly, use a method called tile pulling:

• Send your squad to gather at a resource tile near a cluster of goblins.

• When your squad is approaching the goblins, redirect it to attack one.

• If the next goblin is more than a 10–15 second march away, send your squad to a tile beyond the goblins, then redirect again as it gets close.

This lets you chain attacks quickly without long march times.

See this video for an example:

Here is the video at half speed:

tips.title: The Doomsday
tips.content:
The Doomsday is a server-wide event - the more people who participate, the better it is for all of us. Encourage your alliance members to join at least one rally, at minimum.

• You get 3 first kill rewards, so try to hit at least 3 Doom Walkers.

• If possible, aim to hit level 160 or higher for an SSR survivor. Rewards scale quickly at higher levels, so go as high as your power allows.

The ranking rewards are based on your total damage throughout the day. It doesn't matter if you're leading the rally or just joining. But keep in mind, these rewards are minor compared to the troop loss and stamina cost - so if you're pushing for rank, do it for the fun, not the prize.

While troop losses from Doom Walker attacks are minimal, you can check the Doomsday Threats tab to stay ahead. If you don't want to fight the ones targeting your alliance:

• Start a rally on them, then cancel it - this will usually redirect them.

• They may retarget your alliance 2–3 times, but persistence pays off.


• If you do want to kill an attacking Doom Walker but not spend the stamina, you can garrison the base it is attacking

tips.title: NAP7 Sports Analogy
tips.content:
Imagine we're all in high school.

The football and soccer teams are full of talented, high-profile students. But for whatever reason, many others in the school perceive them as arrogant or unapproachable. Maybe it's how they carry themselves, maybe it's past behavior, or maybe it's just the dynamic that's developed over time. Either way, they're seen by some as the ones always dominating the space and pushing others around... even kids from the chess club, the debate team, and sometimes even the baseball team.

As a result, a lot of strong, capable students choose not to participate. They don't want to be part of something they feel is unfair or aggressive. And because of that, the football and soccer teams struggle when it comes time to actually win games.

But here's the thing: if those teams made a genuine effort to be kind, supportive, and inclusive to everyone in the school district... if they showed respect and created a positive culture, they'd have a massive pool of students eager to join them. People would be excited to be part of that energy. Their games would sell out. They'd attract the best coaches, get the best gear, and build something unstoppable.

So now, the teams decide to fix that by recruiting, or rather pressuring, the strong kids to join them. When persuasion doesn't work, the message turns into something more like:

"If you don't join us, we're going to make your life miserable every day after school."

There's no way for the individual students to stand up to that. No one can take on an entire team.

The solution isn't to double down on fear or pressure. The solution is to fix the reputation. Be the alliance people admire, not the one they brace against. If you become the heroes of the server... the ones who stand up for fairness, respect, and real leadership, people will want to follow you. You'll have more strength, more loyalty, and more staying power than fear could ever buy.

Back to index

tips.title: Why we need small alliances and players
tips.content:
• We need the players who quietly sit below level 27 and rack up easy Arms Race wins.

• We need the low-ranking alliances that sometimes bring in VS wins/mvps because they bottom tiers.

• We need those Desert Storm squads where only 2 or 3 show up, but because of how matchmaking works, that’s still enough to win.

• We need lurkers in world chat to pick off 972 trucks we post because it is easier than searching for their own.

All of these things, even if each has the odds of betting on black in roulette, add up. They generate serious Warzone Duel points. 

Forcing those alliances to disband or pushing those players to quit guarantees we get zero from them, never earn invasion rights, never get those sweet, sweet invasion buffs again.

It may already be too late. We’ve lost so many by going down this same path last time, but we have a plan that could at least give us a shot.

Back to index

tips.title: 996 Plan
tips.content:
What Is Our Goal in 996?

Those of you who know me are probably tired of hearing me say it, but I'll say it again: It's just a game. It should be fun.

For most of us, myself included, "fun" includes kicking ass. And for many, getting our asses kicked over and over again drains the fun entirely. That's exactly what happened last season. We got steamrolled, and nobody enjoyed it.

There are also a huge number of players whose idea of fun is, as Lelii put it, "playing Farmville." And we need to recognize just how essential those players are. They're the foundation that supports the rest of us - the ones who enjoy running and gunning. Without their steady production, daily activity, and logistical support, our ability to fight crumbles. Every role matters.

Now, there's a conversation happening about how to make us stronger as a server. That's good. But I want to challenge the assumption behind one of the most vocal solutions: forced mergers backed by threats of removing NAP status.

Yes, we need to grow our top alliances. But forced consolidation isn't strength. It's short-term numbers at the cost of long-term stability. We've already tried it once. It made a few alliances stronger on paper, but it drove away countless active players. Some of our best - Moose, Ballsak, Gunny - all quit because of the drama and pressure that followed. That strategy didn't leave us stronger. It left us hollow.

If we do it again, we'll repeat the same mistake. We'll get a short-term bump and a long-term decline.

So what should we do instead?

First, let's agree on the real opportunity here. It is a power problem - but it's a power problem we've already lost. We're going up against servers that have far more financial investment behind them. Trying to match them head-to-head is like lining up against Red Coats in a traditional battlefield. That's not going to work for us. If we want to win, we have to take the strategic route - the American Revolution approach - popping out from behind trees, striking smart and fast, and vanishing before they can respond. That requires tight coordination, not just brute strength. And right now, our biggest weakness is communication.

We're not losing because our players are bad or because they're in the "wrong" alliances. We're losing because we don't communicate well enough to align casual players with daily goals that win us the big server-wide events.

The buffs from Warzone Duel, for example, are massive. But we miss out on them because too many players log in and have no idea what needs doing that day. If they had a simple list every day - in their inbox, or on Discord - we'd be racking up points, not losing ground.

That's not a guess. That's something we can start fixing right now.

Here's a better plan to build a powerful server:

  • Get our leadership in sync. Let's bring all willing leaders - big and small - into Discord so we can talk in real time. The in-game chat is simply not built for serious coordination. Messages disappear in seconds, there's no search, no ability to organize by topic, and no easy way to keep track of ongoing discussions. Discord gives us persistent channels, searchable history, threaded conversations, and notifications we can control. It's the only realistic way to maintain strategic, server-wide communication.
  • Treat the server like one giant alliance. Our top alliances should feel like the major leagues - not just powerful, but welcoming, aspirational, and connected to the broader server community. If players see a path to success and recognition, they'll be motivated to grow.
    • Send a daily mail with an agenda. A quick update with what needs to happen each day, what's coming up next, and why it matters.
    • Mentor our smaller alliances. Not everyone has the time or experience to run a well-oiled team, but some of us are really good at it. If we treat the server as the team - not just our individual alliances - we can help way more players than the 100-member limit. Many leaders and players would thrive with just a little support and encouragement. Let's help them grow into their potential instead of replacing them.
  • Establish systems that support all playstyles. Whether someone is a heavy spender or just logs in once a day to harvest, we should have tools, guides, and communities that help them level up. Even in the biggest battle, a level 10 player with a single level 1 troop can ash a whale. There are dozens of ways small players can get involved if we can revitalize communication. When everyone can find a role and grow quickly, they're more likely to invite friends to join them.
  • Launch an outreach and recruitment push. Once the above pieces are in place - reputation repaired, communication flowing, and a sense of progress - we can start promoting the server. Let's create Reddit posts, Facebook outreach - maybe we even have someone who'll make TikToks showcasing what makes our server unique. New players are still coming to this game, and many of the old ones might even return. If we become known as the server where community thrives, they'll want to be here.
  • (Optional) Build a tool to help coordinate. While I'm not willing to commit to anything quite yet, I've already started building a tool for my own alliance, Serenity, at LWSerenity.com. If the need is there, I could create something similar for the entire server to help make communication and coordination automatic and sustainable.

And yes, some smaller alliances do need to consolidate. But let's do it through alignment, not coercion. Let's show players that their play style has a home, that their time matters, and that we actually care how they enjoy the game. That's how you keep a server strong: by building a community, not a prison.

I want to win. I want all of us to win. And I believe we'll only get there by fixing the foundation - not by tearing down what little we have left.

I hope you'll consider this seriously. We're all on the same side here. Let's act like it.

Back to index

tips.title: 996 Moving Forward
tips.content:
To ever win Warzone Duel, we need to grow our server - that means strengthening our top alliances and increasing the number of smaller alliances:

Why small alliances and players matter

Our main issues are poor communication and the reputation some top alliances have for being bullies:

NAP-7 Sports Analogy

If we improve communication and commit to the success of the whole server, we can absolutely win:

The 996 Plan

tips.title: Tiered Troop Training Strategy
tips.content:
To maximize troop production and score high in Unit Progression (Arms Race) and Total Mobilization (Friday VS), train low-level troops continuously. Then, during the events, promote them one level at a time through higher-level barracks.

Barracks can train any level troops up to their max, but they can only promote to their max and nothing lower. So, train one level below what your lowest barrack supports with all of your barracks, and them promote them step-by-step.

Example: If your highest troop level is T9 and you have 4 barracks, train level 5 troops around the clock, then promote them through levels 6, 7, 8, and finally 9 during Unit Progression and Total Mobilization.

Barrack Level Guide:

T1: 1–3
T2: 4–5
T3: 6–9
T4: 10–13
T5: 14–16
T6: 17–19
T7: 20–23
T8: 24–26
T9: 27–29
T10: 30

During Unit Progression:

• Grab Secretary of Security at the start.
• Use speedups to finish any troop batches already training.
• Begin cycling promotions through each barrack.

• If There's a Long Line for the Title and you don’t have troops training, promote a small batch in each barrack timed for a few minutes after your expected title time.

After you begin the promotions

• If you’ll be available, set a timer for 15 minutes before your next promotion batch ends so you can grab the title and finish under its effect.
• If you won’t be available, speed through your first promotion batch once you have the title.

Optimizing for Friday’s Total Mobilization:

• If you're close to your goal, queue a new batch in each barrack one level below your promote minimum.
• Time them to finish an hour or so after reset on Friday.
• All day Friday, set a timer for just before your earliest batch finishes, speed through all the training barracks, and start the next batch.

Ongoing Strategy:

• Whenever a batch finishes, immediately start training another one level below your promote minimum.

Important Tips:

• Barracks train different troop amounts, so you'll sometimes run low on a specific level. To fix this, either:

- Speed through one promotion batch of that level
- Or skip promoting in a higher barrack and train a fresh batch instead

• To even out batch sizes, reverse your survivors: put your best survivors in your lowest-level barrack, working up from there.

Notes

• Lower level troops use significantly less resources and when your base is breeched troops are killed from the lowest to the highest, so this method gives your more powerful and more expensive troops a buffer. However, be careful when attacking because if you run out of your highest level troops, your lower level ones will start taking up space in your ER.
• It takes the exact same amount of time and resources to train low level troops and then promote them to their max, however using speedups on promotions during Unit Progression and Total Mobilization will net you the most points.

tips.title: Protect Troops by stashing them during battle
tips.content:
Protecting Your Troops

Here are proven strategies to keep your troops safe during high-risk events, wars, or when you're away from the game, all while staying battle-ready.

Hospital

Let your hospital fill naturally through events like Marshal, Siege, Loot Goblins, and Doom Walkers. If you need to speed it up, send your weakest squad to a resource tile and have someone with a much stronger squad hit it. As long as your squad lands first, around 60% of your troops will go to the hospital.

If the hospital is getting close to full or you need some troops back, clear a small portion at a time using spam healing. Even in a casual alliance, it's possible to clear around 6,000 troops per minute.

Before a major battle, or once your hospital is nearly full and you don't expect many incoming losses, clear all the room in your hospital by starting healing the entire batch. Aim to keep at least 3 days' worth of healing speedups available at all times.

Emergency Room (ER)

Let your ER fill completely before using the rescue option. Only claim rescued troops when you really need them or once the ER is full again and the cooldown has ended.

Troop Promotions

Promote troops in all available barracks. They are completely safe inside and will not be harmed during attacks.

Garrisons and Deployment

Squads cannot be harmed while marching or garrisoning shielded allies. If no shielded bases are available, send squads to attack zombies in the furthest corner of the map. If you plan to use Squad 1 for combat, send it first to lock in your highest-tier troops, then send Squads 2 and 3. Afterward, recall Squad 1 for use in battle. This is not an effective method if you are teleporting right into the heat of the battle.

Tiered Troop Buffers

While not a perfect defense, using the tiered troop strategy creates a buffer of lower-tier troops. These are the first to die if your base is breached, helping protect your top-tier units.

tips.title: Warzone Participation Letter
tips.content:
Participation Strategy

Hello all!

While Chris, Lightning and I have polar opposite ideas on how to save the server, one thing we agree on is that we need more participation.

Lightning told me that he used me as an example several times today of someone who didn't have T10s yet managed to place 46th. What he didn't know is that I did much of my damage with two level one troops and almost all of it with troop counts in the double digits or lower. With the exception of some march speed, I didn't have any advantage over a level 10 player.

While our smaller alliances don't have the perks and spenders that EviL has, so any representation in the top 100 is impressive, if we share our strategies, we as a server, can do much better on the battlefield, so I'll go first.

Prep Before Entering Battle:

1. Stash as many troops as you can (see Protecting Troops Guide)
2. Spend down as many resources as you can
3. Set all squads to one hero
4. Train 2 level 1 troops in each barrack

The Battle

1. Teleport to another server and set a 4:30 timer (e.g., “Alexa, set a timer for four minutes and 30 seconds”)
2. Teleport back into the server near a base you can cross while pulling to a resource tile.
3. Pull to the tile, select to attack the base, and mash the select squad button until your march time is 0 (or 5 seconds if not directly over the base)
4. If your attack fails, go to your barracks, claim your 2 level 1 troops (and start two more), and send out another squad
5. Once the base is ashed, move to another tile and repeat until you are ashed
6. When your timer goes off, start over from Battle step 1

I really wish I had a longer video and of a success

Extra Tips:

• If you're further from a target, send Squad 1 first, grab two more troops, and send Squad 2 to another resource tile.
• Using two troops is better than one — if your first fails, you can reuse the squad with the remaining troop (shown in video)
• In the mud, exiting battle is slower, giving you a brief window to hit the base again with zero march time
• If you respawn near a pink base, ash it while waiting for your timer
• I find this strategy faster using a touchscreen — one of the few cases where mobile is better than PC

tips.title: Warzone Duel: Capitol War - For Average Players/Troop Dead
tips.content:
Capitol war can only be won if we have overwhelming participation. You may feel that not having a strong enough squad, or losing all of their troops means you are not helpful, but even then, you are the force that slows down and even stops the enemy so the heavy hitters can do their job.

It only takes a single level 1 troop to ash the enemy!

While our smaller alliances don't have the perks and spenders that EviL has, so any representation in the top 100 is impressive, if we share our strategies, we as a server, can do much better on the battlefield, so I'll go first.

Prep Before Entering Battle:

1. Stash as many troops as you can (see Protecting Troops Guide)
2. Spend down as many resources as you can
3. Set all squads to one hero
4. Train 2 level 1 troops in each barrack

The Battle

1. Teleport to another server and set a 4:30 timer (e.g., “Alexa, set a timer for four minutes and 30 seconds”)
2. Teleport back into the server near a base you can cross while pulling to a resource tile.
3. Pull to the tile, select to attack the base, and mash the select squad button until your march time is 0 (or 5 seconds if not directly over the base)
4. If your attack fails, go to your barracks, claim your 2 level 1 troops (and start two more), and send out another squad
5. Once the base is ashed, move to another tile and repeat until you are ashed
6. When your timer goes off, start over from Battle step 1

I really wish I had a longer video and of a success

Extra Tips:

• If you're further from a target, send Squad 1 first, grab two more troops, and send Squad 2 to another resource tile.
• Using two troops is better than one — if your first fails, you can reuse the squad with the remaining troop (shown in video)
• In the mud, exiting battle is slower, giving you a brief window to hit the base again with zero march time
• If you respawn near a pink base, ash it while waiting for your timer
• I find this strategy faster using a touchscreen — one of the few cases where mobile is better than PC



Back to index

tips.title: Warzone Duel: Capitol War - Blockade Guide
tips.content:
To block much more space by the capitol with stationary items:

Prep:

• Save Radar Tasks after you've secured your VS win
• Do NOT run Secret Tasks after reset

Your Job: Slow Down the Enemy

The main goal for smaller players is to delay and block enemy attacks.

1. Block the Capitol Perimeter

Start this 1–2 hours before battle:

• Clear all Radar Tasks except Gathering, Doom Legion and Digs
• Do NOT hit "Go" on the radar screen while one is selected (easy mistake if using Quick Perform)
• A few people at a time Teleport to the edge of the Capitol in an area not yet filled
• NOW Click "Go" on each Secret Task. Do NOT Deploy them you will have until reset to start these)
• NOW Click "Go" on each Gather/Doom Legion/Dig Radar Task. Do NOT start them (you will have 8 hours to do these) R4s, make sure your members don't do the digs!
• Teleport away - your open tasks will block spots around the Capitol

2. Fill the Gaps

1 hour before the battle:

If you're not fighting or are planning to fight from under your shield through garrisons and rallies, teleport near the Capitol:
• Fill in open gaps left in the blockade
• Be strategic - 1 base placed in the right spot (7x7 area) can block 4 enemy bases
• R4s and R5s: use Marshal' Guard to help fill remaining gaps

3. WAR!

How to fight for the average player or when you run out of troops.



Back to index

tips.title: Warzone Duel: Capitol War - Index
tips.content:
If we are invaded, we need to Blockade the Capitol

How to fight for the average player or when you run out of troops.

If you are unable to make the main event, you can still easily get all the rewards

tips.title: Switching Survivors in Tech Centers
tips.content:
If you have more than one Tech Center, the survivors assigned to each one only apply to the techs started in that specific center.

However, survivor boosts are only applied when you start a tech - not while it's in progress.

This means you can move your best survivors between Tech Centers before starting research to get the maximum boost in every center.

tips.title: Top 20 Proposal
tips.content:
Top20 Proposal

To ensure the success of our server, it is crucial for the top 20 alliances to work together. While NAP20 was great for growth, we are now introducing Top20—an agreement that goes beyond avoiding conflict to actively supporting one another.

Encouraging Support

While not mandatory, alliances in Top20 are encouraged to assist one another when facing attackers, especially powerful alliances from other servers.

Key Rules of Top20

  1. No Attacks Within Top20
    Members of Top20 may not, unprovoked, attack another alliance’s:
    • Bases
    • Resource tiles
    • Trade trucks
    • Secret tasks
  2. Automatic Membership
    Any alliance currently ranked in the top 20 by power and has held that position for 24 hours is automatically part of Top20 unless specifically excluded.
  3. Dealing with Rogue Members
    • If a rogue member of an alliance attacks another Top20 member, the individual—not the alliance—will forfeit protection for 24 hours or until they are ashed, whichever comes later.
    • If the rogue behavior continues, the alliance must remove the offending member.
  4. Dealing with Alliance-Wide Violations
    • If multiple members of an alliance repeatedly violate Top20 rules, or if the alliance intentionally coordinates an attack, the entire alliance will lose protection for 24 hours.
    • Continued violations will result in permanent exclusion.
  5. Accountability
    • For an entire alliance to be held accountable, there must be agreement among either:
    * R5s from at least 2 of the top 5 alliances, OR
    * R4s/R5s from at least 4 of the top 5 alliances.
    • Members who retaliate after provocation will not be penalized; instead, the original provocateur forfeits protection.

Reporting and Evidence

If attacked, members should collect verifying screenshots to support claims of provocation or rule-breaking.

Standing together under Top20 will strengthen our server.

tips.title: Free Furnace Use
tips.content:
If the furnace in your base is run for under a minute, you get all the benefits without consuming any coal. This means if you need to survive a blizzard, heat up your base for resource collection, give your troops a morale boost, etc., you can turn your furnace, including overdrive, on for just under a minute, turn it off, and turn it back on again.

⚠️WARNING: Using automation tools is against the last war Terms of Service

If you are on Android, you can automate this process using OP Autoclicker. To learn how, watch the following video

You can also use one of many autoclicking options on windows. I personally have a script that I wrote in AutoHotKey which, if you ask SUPER nicely, I might be willing to share with you.

tips.title: Train Conductor Guide
tips.content:
As conductor of the train, it is your job to make the train gold and appoint a VIP or defender.

To make a train gold, you must refresh it 5 times using the refresh button at the bottom of the train platform screen. Each refresh costs 5 tickets, so you'll need 25 total. If you don't have enough, wait a few minutes while others join and gift you tickets.

Once it's gold, you get all unplundered prizes, so you can keep refreshing until you find a good set. If you see something "good enough," it's best to accept it.

VIP vs Defender:
The only difference is that Defenders can use squads to defend. Most trains get robbed no matter who defends, so don't stress the choice too much.

To assign a VIP or Defender:
• Click the chair icon in the top left of the platform screen
• Follow the prompts
• Wait for them to accept
• Ask which 2 cars they want rewards from and set the green checkmarks on those cars accordingly

tips.title: New applicant questions
tips.content: Thanks for applying!  What has you looking for a new place?  Have you been in an alliance before?  If so why did you leave?

tips.title: Quick Equipment Swap
tips.content:
Quick way to distribute your gear effectively:

  1. Remove all gear from the squad
  2. from most powerful, to least powerful, do the following:
    • If support: Skip
    • Equip all
    • If attacker (fire icon) remove both items on the right
    • If defender, remove both items on the left
  3. starting at most powerful again, go through and Equip all again, making sure support is the last.

tips.title: Loot Boss (Invading Zombie Boss) ranges
tips.content:
This is from the old Last War FAQ. The new FAQ does not have this information. Some conclusions you can draw:

  • If you spawn a certain level, you can assume your top is no higher than 20 above.
        e.g. if you spawn a 70, you can be sure that you can not spawn above 90.
  • * In my experience *, spawning your lowest and highest is pretty rare
        e.g if you 70-80, your highest is is likely 85.

Additionally, I recommend always going through your intel mail individually. This way you can adjust if you see what you thought was your highest was killed. In addition, it is pretty motivating seeing all that goblin loot!

tips.title: Sky Predator Instructions
tips.content:
Sky Predator starts now!

       *** No rallies or digs ***

Ice, gets to occasionally use his Warlord Bomb with our help.
Stay on the map screen and when you see a bomb icon on the left or over Ice's Base, click it rapidly to transfer energy and get contribution points

Rallies take 3 minutes to send but unlike Marshal, they don't autofill. So rally with your THIRD and join with your first.

If you see one get down to 30 seconds, feel free to jump in with your second squad.

tips.title: Sky Predator Instructions
tips.content:
Sky Predator starts now!

       *** No rallies or digs ***

Warlord, gets to occasionally use his Warlord Bomb with our help.
Stay on the map screen and when you see a bomb icon on the left or over their Base, click it rapidly to transfer energy and get contribution points

Rallies take 3 minutes to send but unlike Marshal, they don't autofill. So rally with your THIRD and join with your first.

If you see one get down to 30 seconds, feel free to jump in with your second squad.

tips.title: Spice War Strategy
tips.content:
It is a good day for war!

Our first Spice War battle is 12:30 Server time tomorrow. We're outmanned and outgunned, but not outwitted. For us to stand a chance, we need every possible person defending.

With a nod to the great mind of Doc Brown: Where we're going, we don't need power!

*** Prep ***

Gump squads: For all squads under 27 million power, replace all current heroes with a single hero of the lowest possible level. This is called a gump squad.

  • Make sure you have a bookmark handy to server 994. [How to use bookmarks]

War

  • Garrison the alliance center with your first squad.
  • The moment your squad is knocked out of the alliance center, send the next squad.

If you are hit with a warlord missile

  1. As quickly as you can, teleport to 994 using your saved link.
  2. Click the return arrow in the golden bar at the top of your screen and teleport as close to the mud as you can.
  3. Begin garrisoning again.

Strategy

You might be wondering how a gump squad is going to beat squads of 60 million power. They won't, but we don't have to beat them. A single one of their squads, even the 60M ones, can only fight five of ours, so if we can re-garrison quickly enough, we can slow them down.

If there is anything in this mail that you don't understand, please ask about it in Alliance Chat. If you are not comfortable asking in Alliance Chat, feel free to message me or your favorite R4 (Unless that is Doof).

tips.title: Bookmarks
tips.content:
Creating Bookmarks

To create a bookmark, tap any object on the map. When the info bubble appears, tap the star icon in the upper right.

  • Optionally choose a bookmark type
  • Give the bookmark a memorable name
Using Bookmarks

Open the search panel used to locate Doom Elite's. At the top, select the bookmark type you created, locate the bookmark and press "Go".

If the bookmark is on another server, switch to that server's tab to find it.

tips.title: Free Teleports
tips.content:
Teleport for free by visiting any other server, then return. Use a link or access via events.
Season Play
Tap the season icon (upper right of map/base).
Tap the season banner at the top.
Tap the Grouping icon.
Click Go to any server except your current location.
Enemy Busters
Tap the VS icon (upper right of map/base).
Open the Alliance Assaults tab.
Click Attack.
Other Events: Warzone Duel, Meteor, Sky Battlefront, etc.
Always
Before confirming, verify it shows 0 teleports and your coordinates are correct.
To return, tap the back arrow on the golden bar at the top.
Note: 5-minute cooldown to other servers, but you can go out and immediately back to your own.
